page.title: 05FARMING IN THE AREA
page.content: The farms range in area from small holdings of 5/6 acres to large units of 250.There are 5 large farms,3 mainly dairy with some sheep,2 beef with some sheep.Seventy five per cent of the produce in the area is milk, stored in bulk tanks and taken by road tanker to{Lostwithiel.}There is one unit of 400 store pigs.A few farmers do some market gardening.Some owners simply let fields for grazing and forage.The main crop is grass usually well managed on a 3/4 year rotation and strip grazed with electric fences. Ninety five per cent of winter storage is now silage,usually at least two cuts.Fertilisation is 50/50 dung and chemical.Grass grows for about ten months.Dairy diet is fortified with cattle cake and beef farmers plant some barley.
